com.venmo.touch.client
Class VenmoTouchClient

java.lang.Object
  com.venmo.touch.client.VenmoTouchClient

public class VenmoTouchClient
extends java.lang.Object

Venmo Touch client.

Overview

This class implements the Venmo Touch client protocol, interacting with remote Venmo Touch servers. Most users will create a client instance and pass it to a com.venmo.touch.controller without interacting directly with client methods, other than start() and stop().

In order to exchange data with Venmo, the client must be started using start(), typically done from Activity.onResume(). When finished, the client must be stopped with stop(), typically from Activity.onPause().

Concurrency and Listeners

While running, the client may issue state change callbacks asynchronously, using the VenmoTouchClient.Listener interface. These callbacks will be posted on the main (UI) Android thread.

Except where noted, all public methods are non-blocking and are thus safe to call from the UI thread.

Thread Safety

This class is thread safe.

getCards

public java.util.List<com.venmo.touch.client.internal.models.Card> getCards()
Returns an unmodifiable List of previously-fetched cards.

Unlike reload(), this method operates synchronously and does not involve any I/O.

removeListener

public void removeListener(VenmoTouchClient.Listener listener)
Removes a previously-added listener.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to remove

start

public void start()
Asynchronously opens a connection to the remote Venmo service. This method should be called in onPause() of the Activity hosting the client.

This method is a no-op if the client has already been started.

stop

public void stop()
Closes the connection the remote Venmo service. Callbacks to attached listeners will no longer be delivered after this method returns.

This method should be called in onPause() of the Activity hosting it, and is a no-op if the client has already been stopped.

trackEventAsync

public void trackEventAsync(java.lang.String event)

validateCards

public void validateCards(com.venmo.touch.client.internal.models.Card card,
                          java.util.List<com.venmo.touch.client.internal.models.AuthenticationAnswer> answers)
Submits a list of answers to the Venmo Touch service. The response will arrive asynchronously via VenmoTouchClient.Listener.onCardVerifyFailure(Card, List) or VenmoTouchClient.Listener.onCardVerifySuccess(Card, String).
